summary: This is a U.S. Customs and Border Protection TECS Person Encounter List detailing the flight travel history of Jeffrey Epstein from December 2017 through April 2019. It shows numerous private flights between airports in Florida, New Jersey, the U.S. Virgin Islands, and other locations, primarily using aircraft with tail numbers N212JE and N120JE.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The document is a log of his numerous private flights, primarily between Teterboro, NJ (KTEB), West Palm Beach, FL (KPBI), and St. Thomas, USVI (TIST), from late 2017 through early 2019.

events.title: Flight from West Palm Beach to St. Thomas
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled on a private flight (tail number N120JE) from KPBI to TIST, processed by CBP Customs.

events.title: Vehicle and Flight Entry
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein entered via vehicle (document type B) and also had a flight entry (tail number N212JE) on the same day, with destinations listed as TEB and XXX (unknown airport).

events.title: Most Recent Documented Flight
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's last recorded flight in this log was from LFPB (Le Bourget, Paris) to KTEB (Teterboro, NJ).

locations: TIST (Cyril E. King Airport, St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands)
KISP (Long Island MacArthur Airport, New York)
MDPP (Punta Cana International Airport, Dominican Republic)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was an extremely frequent flyer on private aircraft, with dozens of flights logged in a 16-month period from December 2017 to April 2019.
His primary travel circuit connected Teterboro, NJ (KTEB), West Palm Beach, FL (KPBI), and St. Thomas, USVI (TIST).
The document shows international travel to/from Paris (LFPB), the Dominican Republic (MDPP), and Canada (CYYR).
The aircraft tail numbers most commonly associated with his travel were N212JE and N120JE.
The log was generated by U.S. Customs and Border Protection on April 22, 2019, indicating active monitoring of his movements.
